## Standard Deviation: A Simple Summary

Standard deviation tells us how spread out numbers are. Imagine a bunch of heights: a small standard deviation means most heights are similar, while a large standard deviation means heights vary a lot.

It's like measuring how "wide" a bell curve is.  The symbol Ïƒ (sigma) usually represents standard deviation.

Standard deviation helps us understand data, spot outliers (numbers that are very different), and know how confident we can be in our findings.
